qas.question: When does a candidate swear to fullfil his obligations as a Mason?
What does a candidate swear on?

answers.text: usually on a volume of sacred text

qas.question: How many degrees must a Mason swear to keep the secrets from outsiders?
Are Freemasons free to explore the craft?

answers.text: Freemasons are left to explore the craft in the manner they find most satisfying

qas.question: When does a candidate lose ability to fulfill his obligations as a Mason?

plausible_answers.text: usually on a volume of sacred text

qas.question: What does a candidate sweat on?
How many degrees must a Mason swear to tell outsiders?

plausible_answers.text: explore the ritual and symbolism of the craft

qas.question: What are Freemasons required to do for their craft?

context: <a0_0><b4_0>During the ceremony of initiation<b4_0/><a0_0/>, the candidate is expected to swear (<a1_0><b5_0>usually on a volume of sacred text<b5_0/><a1_0/> appropriate to his personal religious faith) to fulfil certain obligations as a Mason. In the course of <a2_0><b6_0>three degrees<b6_0/><a2_0/>, new masons will promise to keep the secrets of their degree from lower degrees and outsiders, and to support a fellow Mason in distress (as far as practicality and the law permit). There is instruction as to the duties of a Freemason, but on the whole, <a3_0>Freemasons are left to explore the craft in the manner they find most satisfying<a3_0/>. Some will further <b7_0>explore the ritual and symbolism of the craft<b7_0/>, others will focus their involvement on the social side of the Lodge, while still others will concentrate on the charitable functions of the lodge.
